Class LabPImage

java.lang.Object
  LabPImage

public class LabPImage
extends java.lang.Object

LabPImage is a wrapper arround the BufferedImage class. It adds some facilities to access individual pixels components (color and transparency). The coordinate system used by the methods is such that the origin is at the upper left corner.

Constructor Detail

LabPImage

public LabPImage(java.io.File file)
          throws java.io.IOException
Makes a new image initialized with the contents of an image file. The image my be in jpeg or png format.
PRE-CONDITION: The file contains an image in png or jpeg format.
POST-CONDITION: A new object that contains image's pixels is created.

Parameters:
file -
Throws:
java.io.IOException

LabPImage

public LabPImage(java.lang.String filename)
          throws java.io.IOException
Makes a LabPImage instance, initialized with an image file. The argument is the name of the file that contains the image. The image may be in jpeg or png format.
PRE-CONDITION: The filename argument correspond to an existing file that an image in png or jpeg format.
POST-CONDITION: A new object that contains image's pixels is created.

Parameters:
filename -
Throws:
java.io.IOException

LabPImage

public LabPImage(int width,
                 int height)
Makes a new empty image.
PRE-CONDITION: The requested image size must not exceed the available virtual memory of the machine.
POST-CONDITION: A new object that contains transparent pixels is created.

width -
height -

public void writeImageToJPG(java.lang.String filename)

Writes the image to a file (the file name is given) in jpeg format. Not Working !
PRE-CONDITION: The filename argument is a valid file name for the file system being used. The file system must have enough free space to contain the resulting file.
POST-CONDITION: A new file is created that contains the image in jpeg format.

getPixelTransparency

public int getPixelTransparency(int x,
                                int y)
Returns the pixel's transparency level (0 - 255).
PRE-CONDITION: x is in (0 .. width - 1) and y is in (0 .. height - 1)
POST-CONDITION: returns a value in the interval (0 .. 255)

Parameters:
x - pixel coordinate
y - pixel coordinate
Returns:
the pixel's transparency level

setPixelRGB

public void setPixelRGB(int x,
                        int y,
                        int r,
                        int g,
                        int b)
Set a pixel color. The transparency level remains unchanged.
PRE-CONDITION: x is in (0 .. width - 1) and y is in (0 .. height - 1) and r, g and b are in the interval (0 .. 255)
POST-CONDITION: The corresponding pixel is changed according to the given values.

Parameters:
x - pixel coordinate
y - pixel coordinate
r - red component (0 - 255)
g - green component (0 - 255)
b - blue component (0 - 255)

setPixelRGBWithTransparency

public void setPixelRGBWithTransparency(int x,
                                        int y,
                                        int r,
                                        int g,
                                        int b,
                                        int t)
Set a pixel color and transparency.
PRE-CONDITION: x is in (0 .. width - 1) and y is in (0 .. height - 1) and r, g, b and t are in the interval (0 .. 255)
POST-CONDITION: The corresponding pixel is changed according to the given values. Warning: This method is used interaly by the constructors and by the methods setPixelRGB and setPixelGreyLevel,

Parameters:
x - pixel coordinate
y - pixel coordinate
r - red component (0 - 255)
g - green component (0 - 255)
b - blue component (0 - 255)
t - transparency level (0 - 255)

setPixelTransparency

public void setPixelTransparency(int x,
                                 int y,
                                 int t)
Set pixel transparency level. The color remains unchanged.
PRE-CONDITION: x is in (0 .. width - 1) and y is in (0 .. height - 1) and t is in the interval (0 .. 255)
POST-CONDITION: The corresponding pixel is changed according to the given values.

Parameters:
x - pixel coordinate
y - pixel coordinate
t - transparency level (0 - 255)

drawLine

public void drawLine(int x1,
                     int y1,
                     int x2,
                     int y2,
                     int r,
                     int g,
                     int b,
                     int transparency)
Draws a line between (x1, y1) and (x2, y2). The line color is given by the r, g and b arguments and its transparency by the transparency argument.
PRE-CONDITION: x1 and x2 are zero or positive, y1 and y2 are zero or positive, r, g, b and transparency are in the interval (0 .. 255)
POST-CONDITION: The corresponding pixel is changed according to the given values.

Parameters:
x1 - int
y1 - int
x2 - int
y2 - int
r - int
g - int
b - int
transparency - int

filledRectangle

public void filledRectangle(int x1,
                            int y1,
                            int width,
                            int height,
                            int red,
                            int green,
                            int blue,
                            int transparency)
Draws a rectangle with upper left corner at (x1, y1) and dimensions given by the width and height arguments. The rectangle is filled with the color defined by the r, g, b and transparency arguments.
PRE-CONDITION: the values of x1, y1, width and height are such that x1 is in [0 .. width-1], y1 is in [0 .. height-1] x1 + width is in [0 .. width-1] and y1 + height is in [0 .. height-1]. The values of red, green, blue and transparency must be in [0 .. 255].

Parameters:
x1 - int
y1 - int
red - int
green - int
blue - int
transparency - int
